intro: Andesanthus inopinatus, commonly known as the Andean beauty, is a striking flowering plant native to the high Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble petals, which are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered within the vibrant bracts. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
